1.text: Wisdom hath built her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars;

2.text: she hath slaughtered her cattle, she hath mingled her wine, she hath also prepared her table;

3.text: she hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the summits of the high places of the city,

4.text: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither. To him that is void of understanding, she saith,

5.text: Come, eat ye of my bread, and drink of the wine that I have mingled.

6.text: Forsake follies and live, and go in the way of intelligence.

7.text: He that instructeth a scorner getteth to himself shame; and he that reproveth a wicked [man] [getteth] to himself a blot.

8.text: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee; reprove a wise [man], and he will love thee.

9.text: Impart to a wise [man], and he will become yet wiser; teach a righteous [man], and he will increase learning.

10.text: The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of wisdom; and the knowledge of the Holy is intelligence.

11.text: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and years of life shall be added to thee.

12.text: If thou art wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself; and if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.

13.text: The foolish woman is clamorous; she is stupid, and knoweth nothing.

14.text: And she sitteth at the entry of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,

15.text: to call passers-by who go right on their ways:

16.text: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither. And to him that is void of understanding she saith,

17.text: Stolen waters are sweet, and the bread of secrecy is pleasant.

18.text: But he knoweth not that the dead are there; [that] her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
